First we start with Freddie Mac's "Single Family Loan-Level Dataset". That contains a staggering 25.7 million fixed-rate mortgages between January 1, 1999 and March 31, 2017. For exploratory analyses, I'm using a random sample drawn from each year such that we have a total of 895,293 cases. 
```{r echo=FALSE}
yeartab
```
